alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 3:13AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Gusty Winds Likely Sunday and Monday... A series of weak disturbances will create some wind impacts Sunday afternoon and evening and then stronger winds are possible for Monday afternoon and evening. For Sunday, westerly gusts of 30 to 40 mph are expected with gusts up to 50 mph for wind prone locations. For Monday, there is potential for westerly gusts of 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph for wind prone locations. The strongest gusts are expected mainly for locations north of I-80. Blowing dust may reduce visibility on Sunday and Monday afternoon/evenings across portions of western Nevada, in addition to parts of Lassen and eastern Modoc counties in California. These winds will also create a risk for high-profile vehicles, especially on Highway 395 through northeast California. Choppy boating conditions are expected on Lake Tahoe, Pyramid Lake, and Lahontan Reservoir. Rough air can also be expected for aviation. Anyone venturing into the high Sierra backcountry should be prepared for extreme winds across Sierra ridges where gusts 70 to 90 mph are likely.

area.areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California
